com.server

Class GameScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • com.server.GameScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameScheduler
extends java.util.TimerTask
    The GameScheduler is reponsible for executing ComparableCommands from clients, and distributing those commands to other clients. The scheduler is meant to run on a Timer. As such, GameScheduler extends TimerTask.
    Author:
    Stephen Patel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameScheduler(State s)
      Constructs a GameScheduler with a reference to the input State and Server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameScheduler

        public GameScheduler(State s)
        Constructs a GameScheduler with a reference to the input State and Server.
        Parameters:
        s - the State you want ComparableCommands to reference.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        public void schedule(ComparableCommand com)
        This should be used only for AI Commands. Schedules a ComparableCommand for execution. If the command is null, this method silently returns. Otherwise the command has it's State set, prepTime updated, and is added to the schedule.
        Parameters:
        com - the command to schedule.

      • run

        public void run()
        Increments the current time, and performs one iteration of the game loop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask

      • getCurrentTime

        public int getCurrentTime()
        Get's the current game time.
        Returns:
        the number of iterations that have occurred.
